item.title: Let's derive trigonometric identities!
item.author: codingedward@gmail.com (Edward Njoroge)
item.description: Hello, in this post we are going to derive the trigonometric identities. While usually you would refer from a table with these identities when you deem it necessary to apply one, it comes in handy to have most of these memorised. Introduction The trigonometric functions are defined on a right angled triangle $ ABC $ for one of the angles of the triangle, in this case $\alpha$. We start by defining two sides relative to the angle known as the opposite side ($Opp$) and the adjacent side ($Adj$) which is the side that connects the angle to the $\frac{\pi}{2}$ angle.
